trustyai.explainers.SHAPResults

class trustyai.explainers.SHAPResults(shap_results, background)

Wraps SHAP results. This object is returned by the SHAPExplainer, and provides a variety of methods to visualize and interact with the explanation.

__init__(shap_results, background)

Constructor method. This is called internally, and shouldn’t ever need to be used manually.

Methods

__init__(shap_results, background)

Constructor method.

as_dataframe()

Return the SHAP result as a dataframe.

as_html()

Return the SHAP result as a Pandas Styler object.

candlestick_plot()

Visualize the SHAP explanation of each output as a set of candlestick plots, one per output.

getFnull()

Return the list of the found fnulls (y-intercepts) of the SHAP explanations

getSaliencies()

Return the list of the found saliencies.
as_dataframe() → DataFrame

Return the SHAP result as a dataframe.

Returns
pandas.DataFrame

DataFrame containing the results of the SHAP explanation. For each model output, the table will contain the following columns, indexed by feature name:

  • Mean Background Value: The mean value this feature took in the background

  • Feature Value: The value of the feature for this particular input.

  • SHAP Value: The found SHAP value of this feature.

as_html() → Styler

Return the SHAP result as a Pandas Styler object.

Returns
pandas.Styler

Styler containing the results of the SHAP explanation, in the same schema as in as_dataframe(). This will:

  • Color each Feature Value based on how it compares to the corresponding Mean Background Value.

  • Color each SHAP Value based on how their magnitude.

candlestick_plot() → None

Visualize the SHAP explanation of each output as a set of candlestick plots, one per output.

getFnull()

Return the list of the found fnulls (y-intercepts) of the SHAP explanations

Returns
Array[float]

An array of the y-intercepts, in order of the model outputs.

getSaliencies() → List[Saliency]

Return the list of the found saliencies.

Returns
List[Saliency]

A list of Saliency objects, in the order of the model outputs.
